*/********************************************************************/ 00033000
*/*                                                                  */ 00034000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= WTRINIT                                             */ 00035000
*/*                                                                  */ 00036000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= SMF WRITER INITIALIZATION                       */ 00037000
*/*                                                                  */ 00038000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 00039000
*/*  SET UP INTERFACE TO AND ESTABLISH STAE ENVIRONMENT FOR THE SMF  */ 00040000
*/*  WRITER. IF RETURN FROM ESTAE INDICATES FAILURE TO SET UP STAE   */ 00041000
*/*  ENVIRONMENT THEN A SWITCH IS SET FOR THE MAIN SEGMENT. THE      */ 00042000
*/*  ADDRESS OF THE WRITER'S SYNAD ROUTINE IS PLACED IN THE DCB'S OF */ 00043000
*/*  BOTH SMF DATA SETS IF STAE WAS SET UP.                          */ 00044000
*/*                                                                  */ 00045000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 00046000
*/*                                                                  */ 00047000
*/*ENTRY POINT= IN-LINE SEGMENT                                      */ 00048000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 00049000
*/*    SMCAPDCB- MANX DCB ADDRESS                                    */ 00050000
*/*    SMCAADCB- MANY DCB ADDRESS                                    */ 00051000
*/*                                                                  */ 00052000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 00053000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- STAE ENVIRONMENT ESTABLISHED                 */ 00054000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00055000
*/*    DCBSYNAD- WITH ADDRESS OF WRITER'S SYNAD ROUTINE (SWRITERR)   */ 00056000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00057000
*/*                                                                  */ 00058000
*/*  CONDITIONS= STAE ENVIRONMENT NOT SET UP                         */ 00059000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00060000
*/*    STAE- SWITCH SET TO 1                                         */ 00061000
*/********************************************************************/ 00062000
*STAE='0'B;                            /* PRIME FOR SUCCESSFUL STAE  */ 00063000
         NI    STAE,B'11111011'                                    0085 00064000
*STAEFOR='0'B;                         /* INDICATE WRITER STAE       */ 00065000
         NI    STAEFOR,B'01111111'                                 0086 00066000
*STAELIST(1:STAELEN)=DYNMSTAE(1:STAELEN); /* STAE LIST TO DYNAM AREA */ 00067000
         LH    @10,STAELEN                                         0087 00068000
         BCTR  @10,0                                               0087 00069000
         EX    @10,@SM02250                                        0087 00070000
*RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2,REG3) RESTRICTED;                       0088 00071000
*REG2=ADDR(IEEMB825);                  /* ADDR OF STAE ERROR MODULE  */ 00072000
         L     REG2,@CV00081                                       0089 00073000
*REG3=ADDR(STAEPARM);                  /* ADDR OF STAE PARM LIST     */ 00074000
         LA    REG3,STAEPARM                                       0090 00075000
*GENERATE;                                                         0091 00076000
         ESTAE (2),CT,PARAM=(3),PURGE=NONE,ASYNCH=YES,                 *00077000
               MF=(E,STAELIST)                                          00078000
*RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2,REG3) UNRESTRICTED;                     0092 00079000
*RESPECIFY REG15 RESTRICTED;                                       0093 00080000
*IF REG15Â¬=0 THEN                      /* WAS STAE ESTABLISHED OK?   */ 00081000
         LTR   REG15,REG15                                         0094 00082000
         BZ    @RF00094                                            0094 00083000
*  STAE='1'B;                          /* NO, INDICATE STAE FAILED   */ 00084000
         OI    STAE,B'00000100'                                    0095 00085000
*ELSE                                  /* YES                        */ 00086000
*  DO;                                 /* PLACE SYNAD ROUTINE ADDR   */ 00087000
         B     @RC00094                                            0096 00088000
@RF00094 DS    0H                                                  0097 00089000
*    RESPECIFY IHADCB BASED(SMCAPDCB);                             0097 00090000
*    DCBSYNAD=ADDR(SWRITERR);          /* IN DCBS FOR MANX AND MANY  */ 00091000
         LA    @14,52                                              0098 00092000
         L     @10,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0098 00093000
         ALR   @10,@14                                             0098 00094000
         LA    @04,SWRITERR                                        0098 00095000
         ST    @04,DCBSYNAD(,@10)                                  0098 00096000
*    RESPECIFY IHADCB BASED(SMCAADCB);                             0099 00097000
*    DCBSYNAD=ADDR(SWRITERR);                                      0100 00098000
         AL    @14,SMCAADCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0100 00099000
         LA    @10,SWRITERR                                        0100 00100000
         ST    @10,DCBSYNAD(,@14)                                  0100 00101000
*  END;                                                            0101 00102000
*RESPECIFY REG15 UNRESTRICTED;                                     0102 00103000
@RC00094 DS    0H                                                  0103 00104000
*IF STAE='0'B THEN                     /* OPEN SMF DATA SETS IF STAE */ 00105000
         TM    STAE,B'00000100'                                    0103 00106000
         BNZ   @RF00103                                            0103 00107000
*  DO;                                 /* ENVIRONMENT ESTABLISHED    */ 00108000
*/********************************************************************/ 00109000
*/*                                                                  */ 00110000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= INITOPEN                                            */ 00111000
*/*                                                                  */ 00112000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= INITIAL OPENER OF SMF DATA SETS                 */ 00113000
*/*                                                                  */ 00114000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 00115000
*/*         THE FUNCTION OF INITOPEN IS TO OPEN BOTH  SMF DATA SETS  */ 00116000
*/*         AT INITIALIZATION TIME AND SELECT ONE FOR RECORDING.     */ 00117000
*/*         THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY THE FOLLOWING:                   */ 00118000
*/*         1.  AN INDEX INTO A TABLE OF 2 TTR'S (ONE PER DATA SET,  */ 00119000
*/*             EACH TTR BEING THE TTR OF THE LAST BLOCK WRITTEN ON  */ 00120000
*/*             THE DATA SET) IS INITIALIZED FOR THE SMFOPEN ROUTINE */ 00121000
*/*             (WHICH FILLS THE TTR INTO THE TABLE).  THE SMFOPEN   */ 00122000
*/*             ROUTINE IS CALLED TO OPEN THE DATA SET.  IF THE DATA */ 00123000
*/*             SET COULD NOT BE OPENED IT IS MARKED NOT AVAILABLE   */ 00124000
*/*             (SMCAPNAV=ON).                                       */ 00125000
*/*         2.  IF BOTH DATA SETS WERE OPENED SUCCESSFULLY, AND BOTH */ 00126000
*/*             DATA SETS ARE NOT EMPTY, THE DATA SET WITH THE LEAST */ 00127000
*/*             (DETERMINED BY COMPARING THE TTRS RETURNED BY        */ 00128000
*/*             SMFOPEN) IS SELECTED FOR RECORDING.  THE DATA AREA IN*/ 00129000
*/*             SMCA REPRESENTING THIS DATA SET IS MADE TO APPEAR    */ 00130000
*/*             FIRST. A MESSAGE IS ISSUED INFORMING THE OPERATOR TO */ 00131000
*/*             DUMP THE FULLER DATA SET.                            */ 00132000
*/*         3.  IF ONLY ONE DATA SET IS EMPTY, THE DATA SET WHICH IS */ 00133000
*/*             NOT EMPTY IS SELECTED FOR RECORDING.  THE DATA AREA  */ 00134000
*/*             IN SMCA REPRESENTING THIS DATA SET IS MADE TO APPEAR */ 00135000
*/*             FIRST.                                               */ 00136000
*/*         4.  IF BOTH DATA SETS ARE EMPTY, THE PRIMARY DATA SET IS */ 00137000
*/*             SELECTED FOR RECORDING.  THE DATA AREA IN SMCA REPRE-*/ 00138000
*/*             SENTING THE PRIMARY DATA SET APPEARS FIRST (AS IT    */ 00139000
*/*             DOES AFTER THE OPEN HAS BEEN PERFORMED SUCCESSFULLY  */ 00140000
*/*             ON BOTH DATA SETS.)                                  */ 00141000
*/*         5.  A RECORDING MESSAGE IS ISSUED FOR THE SELECTED DATA  */ 00142000
*/*             SET.                                                 */ 00143000
*/*         6.  THE BLKCALC ROUTINE IS CALLED TO CALCULATE THE NUMBER*/ 00144000
*/*             OF BUFFER SIZE SEGMENTS WHICH WILL FIT ON A TRACK OF */ 00145000
*/*             THE DATA SET.                                        */ 00146000
*/*                                                                  */ 00147000
*/*  OPERATION=  NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED.                     */ 00148000
*/*                                                                  */ 00149000
*/*ENTRY POINT= IN-LINE SEGMENT                                      */ 00150000
*/*  INPUT=  SMCA                                                    */ 00151000
*/*          JSCB- JOB STEP CONTROL BLOCK                            */ 00152000
*/*          TCB- TASK CONTROL BLOCK                                 */ 00153000
*/*                                                                  */ 00154000
*/*EXITS= NORMAL                                                     */ 00155000
*/*  CONDITION= BOTH SMF DATA SETS HAVE BEEN OPENED SUCCESSFULLY AND */ 00156000
*/*             ONE HAS BEEN SELECTED FOR RECORDING.                 */ 00157000
*/*  OUTPUT= 1.  A DATA SET HAS BEEN SELECTED FOR RECORDING AND THE  */ 00158000
*/*              DATA AREA IN SMCA, OF THIS DATA SET, APPEARS FIRST  */ 00159000
*/*              IN SMCA.                                            */ 00160000
*/*          2.  IF BOTH DATA SETS WERE NOT EMPTY, A DUMP MESSAGE IS */ 00161000
*/*              ISSUED FOR THE FULLER DATA SET.                     */ 00162000
*/*          3.  A RECORDING MESSAGE IS ISSUED FOR THE SELECTED DATA */ 00163000
*/*              SET.                                                */ 00164000
*/*          4.  THE NUMBER OF BUFFER SIZE SEGMENTS WHICH WILL FIT ON*/ 00165000
*/*              A TRACK OF THE NEW DATA SET HAS BEEN CALCULATED.    */ 00166000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00167000
*/*                                                                  */ 00168000
*/*EXIT= ERROR                                                       */ 00169000
*/*  CONDITION= AN SMF DATA SET COULD NOT BE OPENED.                 */ 00170000
*/*  OUTPUT= THE DATA SET NOT AVAILABLE BIT IN SMCA (SMCAPNAV) IS    */ 00171000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00172000
*/*    SMCADSNF- DATA SET NOT FOUND SET IF OBTAIN FAILURE            */ 00173000
*/*    SMCAOPFL- SET ON IF OPEN FAILURE                              */ 00174000
*/*    SMCAPNAV- DATA SET NOT AVAILABLE BIT SET ON                   */ 00175000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00176000
*/*                                                                  */ 00177000
*/********************************************************************/ 00178000
*RESPECIFY TCB BASED(TCBPTR);                                      0105 00179000
*RESPECIFY REG1 RESTRICTED;                                        0106 00180000
*GEN(GETJSCB);                         /* OBTAIN NEW JSCB FOR WRITER */ 00181000
         GETJSCB                                                        00182000
*REG1->JSCBSEC1=JSCBSEC1;              /* COPY COMMON SECTION OF JSCB*/ 00183000
         L     @10,CVTPTR                                          0108 00184000
         L     @10,CVTTCBP(,@10)                                   0108 00185000
         L     @10,TCBPTR(,@10)                                    0108 00186000
         L     @04,TCBJSCB(,@10)                                   0108 00187000
         MVC   JSCBSEC1(72,REG1),JSCBSEC1(@04)                     0108 00188000
*REG1->JSCBSEC3=JSCBSEC3;              /* COPY VS/2 SECTION OF JSCB  */ 00189000
         MVC   JSCBSEC3(120,REG1),JSCBSEC3(@04)                    0109 00190000
*RESPECIFY IEZJSCB BASED(REG1);                                    0110 00191000
*JSCBPASS='1'B;                        /* BYPASS PASSWORD PROTECTION */ 00192000
         OI    JSCBPASS(REG1),B'10000000'                          0111 00193000
*JSCBDBTB=JSCBDBTB && JSCBDBTB;        /* ZERO DEB TABLE ADDRESS     */ 00194000
         L     @04,JSCBDBTB(,REG1)                                 0112 00195000
         LR    @00,@04                                             0112 00196000
         XR    @00,@04                                             0112 00197000
         ST    @00,JSCBDBTB(,REG1)                                 0112 00198000
*TCBJSCB=REG1;                         /* POINT WRITER'S TCB TO THE     00199000
*                                         NEW JSCB                   */ 00200000
         ST    REG1,TCBJSCB(,@10)                                  0113 00201000
*RESPECIFY REG1 UNRESTRICTED;                                      0114 00202000
*DO I=1 TO 2 WHILE(SMCAPNAV='0'B);      /* OPEN BOTH SMF D.S. BUT  0115 00203000
*                                         STOP IF AN OPEN FAILURE    */ 00204000
         LA    @10,1                                               0115 00205000
         STC   @10,I                                               0115 00206000
@DL00115 TM    SMCAPNAV(SMCAPTR),B'10000000'                       0115 00207000
         BNZ   @DC00115                                            0115 00208000
*  TTRINDEX=I;                         /* SET THE TTR INDEXER FOR    */ 00209000
         STC   @10,TTRINDEX                                        0116 00210000
*  CALL SMFOPEN;                       /* SMFOPEN ROUTINE.           */ 00211000
         BAL   @14,SMFOPEN                                         0117 00212000
*END;                                                              0118 00213000
         LA    @10,1                                               0118 00214000
         SLR   @04,@04                                             0118 00215000
         IC    @04,I                                               0118 00216000
         ALR   @10,@04                                             0118 00217000
         STC   @10,I                                               0118 00218000
         CH    @10,@CH00047                                        0118 00219000
         BNH   @DL00115                                            0118 00220000
@DC00115 DS    0H                                                  0119 00221000
*IF SMCAPNAV='0'B THEN                 /* IF BOTH D.S. WERE OPENED 0119 00222000

         OI    DUMPMSG,B'10000000'                                 0134 00261000

         BAL   @14,INVKEXIT                                        0136 00265000
*      END;                            /*                    @Z40FPPF*/ 00266000

*      DO;                             /* ARE KNOWN TO BE EMPTY      */ 00268000
         B     @RC00121                                            0138 00269000
@RF00121 DS    0H                                                  0139 00270000
*        IF SMCAAMTY='0'B THEN         /* IF ALTERNATE IS NOT EMPTY  */ 00271000
         TM    SMCAAMTY(SMCAPTR),B'00010000'                       0139 00272000
         BNZ   @RF00139                                            0139 00273000
*          DO;                         /* SWITCH THE DATA SET AREAS  */ 00274000
*            DEVAREAA=DEVAREAA && DEVAREAB; /* IN SMCA SO THE NON    */ 00275000
         LA    @10,24                                              0141 00276000
         ALR   @10,SMCAPTR                                         0141 00277000
         LA    @04,40                                              0141 00278000
         ALR   @04,SMCAPTR                                         0141 00279000
         XC    DEVAREAA(16,@10),DEVAREAB(@04)                      0141 00280000
*            DEVAREAB=DEVAREAB && DEVAREAA; /* EMPTY ONE WILL BE     */ 00281000
         XC    DEVAREAB(16,@04),DEVAREAA(@10)                      0142 00282000
*            DEVAREAA=DEVAREAA && DEVAREAB; /* RECORDED ON           */ 00283000
         XC    DEVAREAA(16,@10),DEVAREAB(@04)                      0143 00284000
*          END;                                                    0144 00285000
*      END;                                                        0145 00286000
@RF00139 DS    0H                                                  0146 00287000
*    RECGMSG='1'B;                     /* ISSUE RECORDING MESSAGE    */ 00288000
@RC00121 OI    RECGMSG,B'00010000'                                 0146 00289000
*    CALL WRITEMSG;                                                0147 00290000
         BAL   @14,WRITEMSG                                        0147 00291000
*    CALL BLKCALC;                     /* CALL RTN TO DETERMINE NO.  */ 00292000
         BAL   @14,BLKCALC                                         0148 00293000
*  END;                                /* OF BUF SIZE SEG WHICH WILL    00294000
*                                         FIT ON A TRK OF NEW D.S.   */ 00295000
*    IF SMCAPNAV='0'B THEN             /* WERE BOTH DATA SETS OPENED?*/ 00296000
@RF00119 TM    SMCAPNAV(SMCAPTR),B'10000000'                       0150 00297000
         BNZ   @RF00150                                            0150 00298000
*      DO;                             /* YES                        */ 00299000
*        RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2) RESTRICTED;                    0152 00300000
*        REG2=ADDR(SMCABECB);          /* LOAD POST ECB              */ 00301000
         LA    REG2,SMCABECB(,SMCAPTR)                             0153 00302000
*        GEN(POST  (2));               /* POST INITIALIZATION        */ 00303000
         POST  (2)                                                      00304000
*        RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2) UNRESTRICTED;                  0155 00305000
*        WRITER='1'B;                  /* INDICATE WRITER ACTIVE     */ 00306000
         OI    WRITER,B'10000000'                                  0156 00307000
*        DO WHILE(WRITER='1'B);        /* START WAIT LOOP            */ 00308000
         B     @DE00157                                            0157 00309000
@DL00157 DS    0H                                                  0158 00310000
*          RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2) RESTRICTED;                  0158 00311000
*          REG2=ADDR(SMCAWECB);        /* LOAD ADDRESS OF WAIT ECB   */ 00312000
         LA    REG2,SMCAWECB(,SMCAPTR)                             0159 00313000
*          GEN(WAIT  ECB=(2));         /* *****WRITER WAIT*****      */ 00314000
         WAIT  ECB=(2)                                                  00315000
*          RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2) UNRESTRICTED;                0161 00316000
*          SMCAWECB=SMCAWECB && SMCAWECB; /* CLEAR WRITER ECB        */ 00317000
         XC    SMCAWECB(4,SMCAPTR),SMCAWECB(SMCAPTR)               0162 00318000
*          IF SMCABSW='1'B THEN        /* SET UP THE POINTERS TO THE */ 00319000
         TM    SMCABSW(SMCAPTR),B'00000010'                        0163 00320000
         BNO   @RF00163                                            0163 00321000
*            DO;                       /* CURRENT AND NON CURRENT    */ 00322000
*              BUFPTR(1)=SMCABUFP+SMCABSIZ;    /* SMF BUFFERS        */ 00323000
         L     @10,SMCABUFP(,SMCAPTR)                              0165 00324000
         LR    @04,@10                                             0165 00325000
         AL    @04,SMCABSIZ(,SMCAPTR)                              0165 00326000
         ST    @04,BUFPTR                                          0165 00327000
*              BUFPTR(2)=SMCABUFP;                                 0166 00328000
         ST    @10,BUFPTR+4                                        0166 00329000
*            END;                                                  0167 00330000
*          ELSE                                                    0168 00331000
*            DO;                                                   0168 00332000
         B     @RC00163                                            0168 00333000
@RF00163 DS    0H                                                  0169 00334000
*              BUFPTR(1)=SMCABUFP;                                 0169 00335000
         L     @10,SMCABUFP(,SMCAPTR)                              0169 00336000
         ST    @10,BUFPTR                                          0169 00337000
*              BUFPTR(2)=SMCABUFP+SMCABSIZ;                        0170 00338000

*            END;                                                  0171 00341000
*          IF SMCADSTR='0'B THEN       /* ENTERED DURING DISASTER    */ 00342000
@RC00163 TM    SMCADSTR(SMCAPTR),B'01000000'                       0172 00343000
         BNZ   @RF00172                                            0172 00344000
*            DO;                       /* NO- DETERMINE FUNCTION     */ 00345000
*              IF SMCADSSP='1'B THEN   /* PERFORM SPACE CHECKING?    */ 00346000
         TM    SMCADSSP(SMCAPTR),B'00000010'                       0174 00347000
         BNO   @RF00174                                            0174 00348000
*                DO;                   /* YES                        */ 00349000
*/********************************************************************/ 00350000
*/*                                                                  */ 00351000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= SPACECHK                                            */ 00352000
*/*                                                                  */ 00353000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= SPACE CHECK SMF DATA SET                        */ 00354000
*/*                                                                  */ 00355000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 00356000
*/*  CHECK TO SEE THAT THERE IS ENOUGH SPACE REMAINING IN THE RE-    */ 00357000
*/*  CORDING DATA SET TO WRITE ALL SEGMENTS OF A SEGMENTED RECORD. IF*/ 00358000
*/*  THERE IS NOT ENOUGH SPACE AND THE DATA SET IS NOT EMPTY, THEN   */ 00359000
*/*  CALL DSSWITCH TO SWITCH RECORDING TO THE OTHER SMF DATA SET.    */ 00360000
*/*  WHEN SWITCH IS COMPLETE, SPACE CHECK IS REPEATED FOR THE NEW    */ 00361000
*/*  DATA SET. IF THE SEGMENTED RECORD EXCEEDS THE SIZE OF AN EMPTY  */ 00362000
*/*  SMF DATA SET IT WILL BE TRUNCATED BY IEEMB830.                  */ 00363000
*/*                                                                  */ 00364000
*/*  OPERATION=                                                      */ 00365000
*/*    FIRST IT IS DETERMINED WHETHER ANY SEGMENTS WILL FIT IN THE   */ 00366000
*/*    REMAINING SPACE OF THE CURRENT TRACK. IF SO, THE NUMBER THAT  */ 00367000
*/*    WILL FIT IS CALCULATED:                                       */ 00368000
*/*    THE DCB TRACK BALANCE IS REDUCED BY THE SIZE OF A BUFFER +    */ 00369000
*/*    OVERHEAD FOR THE LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK ACCOUNTING FOR ONE     */ 00370000
*/*    SEGMENT THAT WILL FIT. THE REMAINING TRACK BALANCE IS DIVIDED */ 00371000
*/*    BY A VALUE EQUAL TO THE SIZE OF A BUFFER + OVERHEAD FOR A     */ 00372000
*/*    BLOCK THAT IS NOT THE LAST ON A TRACK ACCOUNTING FOR THE      */ 00373000
*/*    REST OF THE SEGMENTS THAT WILL FIT ON THE CURRENT TRACK. IF   */ 00374000
*/*    THIS SEGMENT COUNT IS EQUAL OR GREATER THAN THE NO. OF SEG-   */ 00375000
*/*    MENTS REQUIRED, THEN SPACE CHECK IS DONE SINCE ALL SEGMENTS   */ 00376000
*/*    WILL FIT ON THE SPACE REMAINING ON THE CURRENT TRACK.         */ 00377000
*/*                                                                  */ 00378000
*/*    WHEN ALL SEGMENTS WILL NOT FIT ON THE CURRENT TRACK, SPACECHK */ 00379000
*/*    MUST THEN DETERMINE WHETHER THE REST OF THE DATA SET IS LARGE */ 00380000
*/*    ENOUGH TO CONTAIN THEM. THE ABSOLUTE DASD ADDRESS OF THE LAST */ 00381000
*/*    RECORD WRITTEN TO THE SMF DATA SET (DCBFDAD) IS PASSED TO A   */ 00382000
*/*    RESIDENT CONVERT ROUTINE (IECPRLTV) TO OBTAIN THE TTR FORMAT. */ 00383000
*/*    THE FOLLOWING CALCULATION GIVES THE NO. OF ADDITIONAL TRACKS  */ 00384000
*/*    NEEDED TO CONTAIN THE REMAINING SEGMENTS:                     */ 00385000
*/*    TRKS REQUIRED = REMAINING SEGMENTS (TOTAL SEGS - NO. SEGS THAT*/ 00386000
*/*                                       FIT ON CURRENT TRACK)      */ 00387000
*/*                    DIVIDED BY                                    */ 00388000
*/*                    NO. BUFFER SIZE BLOCKS THAT FIT ON A TRACK    */ 00389000
*/*                    PLUS 1 IF ANY REMAINDER                       */ 00390000
*/*                    PLUS                                          */ 00391000
*/*                    1 TRACK (ALLOWANCE FOR CLOSE PROCESSING)      */ 00392000
*/*    THE NUMBER OF TRACKS REQUIRED IS ADDED TO THE TTR VALUE       */ 00393000
*/*    REPRESENTING THE LAST RECORD WRITTEN TO OBTAIN THE TTR WHICH  */ 00394000
*/*    CAN HOLD ALL SEGMENTS OF THE RECORD. THIS TTR IS PASSED TO A  */ 00395000
*/*    SECOND RESIDENT CONVERT ROUTINE. THIS ROUTINE CONVERTS THE    */ 00396000
*/*    TTR TO AN ABSOLUTE DASD ADDRESS AND SENDS BACK A RETURN CODE  */ 00397000
*/*    INDICATING WHETHER THE TTR IS WITHIN THE EXTENTS OF THE SMF   */ 00398000
*/*    DATA SET. IF ALL SEGMENTS DO NOT FIT AND THE DATA SET IS NOT  */ 00399000
*/*    EMPTY A DATA SET SWITCH IS ATTEMPTED AND SPACE CHECKING IS    */ 00400000
*/*    DONE FOR THE OTHER. IF THE DATA SET IS EMPTY AND ALL SEGMENTS */ 00401000
*/*    DO NOT FIT, SPACE CHECK REDUCES THE TTR REQUIRED FOR ALL      */ 00402000
*/*    SEGMENTS BY ONE AND CALLS THE CONVERT ROUTINE. THIS IS REPEAT-*/ 00403000
*/*    ED UNTIL THE CONVERT ROUTINE INDICATES THAT THE TTR IS WITHIN */ 00404000
*/*    THE DATA SET EXTENTS. THEN SMCASGFT(NO. OF SEGMENTS THAT CAN  */ 00405000
*/*    BE WRITTEN TO THE DATA SET NOT EXCEEDING THE NO. REQUESTED)   */ 00406000
*/*    IS CALCULATED:                                                */ 00407000
*/*    SMCASGFT = NO. OF SEGMENTS THAT FIT ON CURRENT TRACK          */ 00408000
*/*               PLUS                                               */ 00409000
*/*               NO. SEGMENTS THAT CAN FIT ON THE REST OF THE DATA  */ 00410000
*/*               SET (THIS VALUE = TTR FOUND TO FIT                 */ 00411000
*/*                    MINUS TTR OF LAST RECORD WRITTEN              */ 00412000
*/*                    MINUS 1                                       */ 00413000
*/*                    TIMES THE NO. OF SEGMENTS THAT FIT ON A TRACK)*/ 00414000
*/*    THIS VALUE IS RETURNED TO IEEMB830 WHO WILL PERFORM TRUNCATION*/ 00415000
*/*                                                                  */ 00416000
*/*    IF THE DATA SET IS LARGE ENOUGH TO CONTAIN ALL SEGMENTS, THEN */ 00417000
*/*    SMCASGFT IS SET EQUAL TO THE NUMBER OF SEGMENTS REQUIRED TO   */ 00418000
*/*    CONTAIN THE RECORD(SMCASGWR).                                 */ 00419000
*/*                                                                  */ 00420000
*/*    CONVERT ROUTINE INTERFACES:                                   */ 00421000
*/*    IECPRLTV- RESIDENT ROUTINE THAT CONVERTS AN ABSOLUTE DASD     */ 00422000
*/*              ADDRESS(MBBCCHHR) TO ITS RELATIVE EQUVALENT(TTR0).  */ 00423000
*/*                                                                  */ 00424000
*/*              REGISTER       ENTRY          EXIT                  */ 00425000
*/*                 0       IGNORED         OUTPUT- TTR0 RESULT      */ 00426000
*/*                 1       DEB ADDRESS     TRANSPARENT              */ 00427000
*/*                 2       CORE ADDRESS    TRANSPARENT              */ 00428000
*/*                         OF MBBCCHHR                              */ 00429000
*/*                 3-8     IGNORED         TRANSPARENT              */ 00430000
*/*                 9-13    IGNORED         DESTROYED                */ 00431000
*/*                 14      RETURN ADDRESS  TRANSPARENT              */ 00432000
*/*                 15      ENTRY ADDRESS   ZERO                     */ 00433000
*/*                                                                  */ 00434000
*/*    IECPCNVT- RESIDENT ROUTINE THAT CONVERTS A RELATIVE DASD      */ 00435000
*/*              ADDRESS AND CONCATENATION NUMBER(TTRN) TO ITS       */ 00436000
*/*              ABSOLUTE EQUVALENT(MBBCCHHR). A RETURN CODE OF ZERO */ 00437000
*/*              INDICATES A SUCCESSFUL CONVERSION AND A 4 IF THE    */ 00438000
*/*              VALUE OF TT EXCEEDS TOTAL EXTENTS ASSIGNED.         */ 00439000
*/*                                                                  */ 00440000
*/*              REGISTER       ENTRY          EXIT                  */ 00441000
*/*                 0       INPUT- TTRN     DESTROYED                */ 00442000
*/*                 1       DEB ADDRESS     DESTROYED                */ 00443000
*/*                 2       ADDRESS OF 8    TRANSPARENT              */ 00444000
*/*                         BYTE AREA FOR                            */ 00445000
*/*                         MBBCCHHR                                 */ 00446000
*/*                 3-8     IGNORED         TRANSPARENT              */ 00447000
*/*                 9-13    IGNORED         DESTROYED                */ 00448000
*/*                 14      RETURN ADDRESS  TRANSPARENT              */ 00449000
*/*                 15      IGNORED         RETURN CODE              */ 00450000
*/*                                                                  */ 00451000
*/*ENTRY POINT= IN-LINE SEGMENT                                      */ 00452000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 00453000
*/*    SMCASGWR- NO. OF SEGMENTS NEEDED TO CONTAIN SPLIT RECORD      */ 00454000
*/*    DCBTRBAL- CURRENT TRACK BALANCE FOR RECORDING DATA SET        */ 00455000
*/*    BLKSILST- BUFFER SIZE + OVERHEAD FOR LAST BLK ON A TRACK      */ 00456000
*/*    BLKSIZNL- BUFFER SIZE + OVERHEAD NOT LAST BLK ON A TRACK      */ 00457000
*/*    BLKONTRK- NO. OF BUFFER SEGMENTS THAT FIT ON 1 TRACK INCLUDING*/ 00458000
*/*              OVERHEAD                                            */ 00459000
*/*    RECORDING DATA SET DCB                                        */ 00460000
*/*    CVTPRLTV- ADDRESS OF IECPRLTV IN CVT                          */ 00461000
*/*    CVTPCNVT- ADDRESS OF IECPCNVT IN CVT                          */ 00462000
*/*                                                                  */ 00463000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 00464000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- DATA SET CHECKED TO SEE IF ALL SEGMENTS      */ 00465000
*/*             WILL FIT                                             */ 00466000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00467000
*/*    SMCASGFT- NO. OF SEGMENTS THAT CAN BE WRITTEN TO THE DATA SET */ 00468000
*/*              = SMCASGWR IF ALL SEGMENTS CAN BE WRITTEN           */ 00469000
*/*              < SMCASGWR IF ALL DO NOT FIT AND TRUNCATION NEEDED  */ 00470000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00471000
*/*                                                                  */ 00472000
*/*  CONDITION= DISASTER CONDITION ENTERED TRYING TO SWITCH TO AN    */ 00473000
*/*             EMPTY DATA SET                                       */ 00474000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00475000
*/*    SMCADSCT- RECORD LOST COUNT UPDATED                           */ 00476000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00477000
*/*                                                                  */ 00478000
*/********************************************************************/ 00479000
*RESPECIFY IHADCB BASED(SMCAPDCB);                                 0176 00480000
*DATASET='0'B;                                                     0177 00481000
         NI    DATASET,B'10111111'                                 0177 00482000
*RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2,REG3,REG15) RESTRICTED;                 0178 00483000
*DO K=1 TO 2 WHILE(SMCADSTR='0'B & DATASET='0'B);                  0179 00484000
         LA    @14,1                                               0179 00485000
         STC   @14,K                                               0179 00486000
@DL00179 TM    SMCADSTR(SMCAPTR),B'01000000'                       0179 00487000
         BNZ   @DC00179                                            0179 00488000
         TM    DATASET,B'01000000'                                 0179 00489000
         BNZ   @DC00179                                            0179 00490000
*  SEGCNTR=0;                          /* INITIALIZE SEGMENT COUNTER */ 00491000
         SLR   SEGCNTR,SEGCNTR                                     0180 00492000
*  SMCASGFT=SMCASGWR;                  /* INITIALIZE NO. OF SEGMENTS    00493000
*                                         THAT FIT TO NO. REQUESTED  */ 00494000
         MVC   SMCASGFT(4,SMCAPTR),SMCASGWR(SMCAPTR)               0181 00495000
*  IF DCBTRBAL>=BLKSILST THEN          /* ENUF ROOM ON CURRENT TRACK */ 00496000
         LH    @14,BLKSILST                                        0182 00497000
         L     @10,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0182 00498000
         LA    @10,DCBFDAD(,@10)                                   0182 00499000
         LH    @10,DCBTRBAL+7(,@10)                                0182 00500000
         CR    @10,@14                                             0182 00501000
         BL    @RF00182                                            0182 00502000
*    DO;                               /* TO HOLD AT LEAST ONE BLOCK */ 00503000
*      SPACELFT=DCBTRBAL-BLKSILST;     /* REDUCE TRK BALANCE BY LEN     00504000
*                                         OF LAST BLK ON A TRK       */ 00505000
         SLR   @10,@14                                             0184 00506000
         LR    SPACELFT,@10                                        0184 00507000
*      SEGCNTR=1;                      /* AT LEAST ONE BLK FITS      */ 00508000
         LA    SEGCNTR,1                                           0185 00509000
*      IF SPACELFT>=BLKSIZNL THEN      /* ROOM FOR ANY MORE BLKS     */ 00510000
         LH    @14,BLKSIZNL                                        0186 00511000
         CR    SPACELFT,@14                                        0186 00512000
         BL    @RF00186                                            0186 00513000
*        SEGCNTR=SEGCNTR+(SPACELFT/BLKSIZNL); /* CALC NO. OF BLKS    */ 00514000
         LR    @08,SPACELFT                                        0187 00515000
         SRDA  @08,32                                              0187 00516000
         DR    @08,@14                                             0187 00517000
         ALR   SEGCNTR,@09                                         0187 00518000
*    END;                              /* THAT FIT ON CURRENT TRK    */ 00519000
@RF00186 DS    0H                                                  0189 00520000
*  IF SEGCNTR<SMCASGWR THEN            /* SPACE CHECK COMPLETE?      */ 00521000
@RF00182 L     @14,SMCASGWR(,SMCAPTR)                              0189 00522000
         CR    SEGCNTR,@14                                         0189 00523000
         BNL   @RF00189                                            0189 00524000
*    DO;                               /* NO, CONTINUE CHECK         */ 00525000
*      REQTRKS=((SMCASGWR-SEGCNTR)/BLKONTRK)+1;    /* CALC NO. OF    */ 00526000
         LA    @10,1                                               0191 00527000
         LH    @04,BLKONTRK                                        0191 00528000
         SLR   @14,SEGCNTR                                         0191 00529000
         LR    @08,@14                                             0191 00530000
         SRDA  @08,32                                              0191 00531000
         DR    @08,@04                                             0191 00532000
         ALR   @09,@10                                             0191 00533000
         LR    REQTRKS,@09                                         0191 00534000
*      IF (SMCASGWR-SEGCNTR)//BLKONTRKÂ¬=0 THEN    /* TRKS NEEDED TO  */ 00535000
         LR    @08,@14                                             0192 00536000
         SRDA  @08,32                                              0192 00537000
         DR    @08,@04                                             0192 00538000
         LTR   @08,@08                                             0192 00539000
         BZ    @RF00192                                            0192 00540000
*        REQTRKS=REQTRKS+1;            /* CONTAIN ALL SEGMENTS OF A     00541000
*                                         SPLIT RECORD               */ 00542000
         ALR   REQTRKS,@10                                         0193 00543000
*      REG1=DCBDEBAD;                  /* DEB ADDR                   */ 00544000
@RF00192 L     @14,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0194 00545000
         L     REG1,DCBDEBAD+40(,@14)                              0194 00546000
*      REG2=ADDR(DCBFDAD);             /* ADDR OF MBBCCHHRR TO CONVRT*/ 00547000
         LA    REG2,DCBFDAD(,@14)                                  0195 00548000
*      REG3=ADDR(B829SAVE);            /* SAVEAREA ADDR              */ 00549000
         LA    REG3,B829SAVE                                       0196 00550000
*      GEN(STM   4,14,B829SAVE);       /* SAVE REGISTERS             */ 00551000
         STM   4,14,B829SAVE                                            00552000
*      CALL CONVERT1;                  /* IECPRLTV- ABSOLUTE TO TTR  */ 00553000
         L     @10,CVTPTR                                          0198 00554000
         L     @15,CVTPRLTV(,@10)                                  0198 00555000
         BALR  @14,@15                                             0198 00556000
*      GEN(LM    4,14,0(3));           /* RESTORE REGISTERS          */ 00557000
         LM    4,14,0(3)                                                00558000
*      SMFTTR1=REG0/65536;             /* TTR OF LAST REC WRITTEN    */ 00559000
         LR    @14,REG0                                            0200 00560000
         SRL   @14,16                                              0200 00561000
         ST    @14,SMFTTR1                                         0200 00562000
*      REG0=REG0+(REQTRKS*65536);      /* ADD REQ NO. OF TRKS        */ 00563000
         LR    @14,REQTRKS                                         0201 00564000
         SLA   @14,16                                              0201 00565000
         ALR   REG0,@14                                            0201 00566000
*      REQTTR=REG0;                    /* TTR THAT CAN HOLD ALL SEGS */ 00567000
         ST    REG0,REQTTR                                         0202 00568000
*      REG2=ADDR(DASDADDR);            /* ADDR TO RECEIVE MBBCCHHR   */ 00569000
         LA    REG2,DASDADDR                                       0203 00570000
*      GEN(STM   4,14,B829SAVE);       /* SAVE REGISTERS             */ 00571000
         STM   4,14,B829SAVE                                            00572000
*      CALL CONVERT2;                  /* IECPCNVT- TTR TO ABSOLUTE  */ 00573000
         L     @10,CVTPTR                                          0205 00574000
         L     @15,CVTPCNVT(,@10)                                  0205 00575000
         BALR  @14,@15                                             0205 00576000
*      GEN(LM    4,14,0(3));           /* RESTORE REGISTERS          */ 00577000
         LM    4,14,0(3)                                                00578000
*      IF REG15Â¬=0 THEN                /* WILL ALL SEGMENTS FIT?     */ 00579000
         LTR   REG15,REG15                                         0207 00580000
         BZ    @RF00207                                            0207 00581000
*        DO;                           /* NO, CALC NO. THAT WILL     */ 00582000
*          IF SMCAPMTY='1'B THEN       /* FIT IF DATA SET IS EMPTY   */ 00583000
         TM    SMCAPMTY(SMCAPTR),B'00010000'                       0209 00584000
         BNO   @RF00209                                            0209 00585000
*            DO;                                                   0210 00586000

*/********************************************************************/ 00688000
*/*                                                                  */ 00689000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= RECWRITE                                            */ 00690000
*/*                                                                  */ 00691000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= RECORD PROCESSOR                                */ 00692000
*/*                                                                  */ 00693000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 00694000
*/*  PERFORM SPACE CHECK FOR NON-SEGMENTED RECORDS AND DO BUFFER     */ 00695000
*/*  SWITCHING. THE ABSOLUTE DASD ADDRESS OF THE LAST RECORD         */ 00696000
*/*  IS CONVERTED TO ITS TTR EQUVALENT(IECPRLTV). TWO TRACKS ARE     */ 00697000
*/*  ADDED AND THE NEW TTR IS CONVERTED(IECPCNVT) TO AN ABSOLUTE     */ 00698000
*/*  ADDRESS. IF THE RETURN CODE FROM THE CONVERT ROUTINE INDICATES  */ 00699000
*/*  THAT THE ADDRESS IS WITHIN DATA SET EXTENTS, THE BUFFERS ARE    */ 00700000
*/*  SWITCHED, IEEMB830 IS POSTED AND BWRITER IS CALLED TO WRITE THE */ 00701000
*/*  BUFFER.                                                         */ 00702000
*/*  IF THE NEW ADDRESS IS OUTSIDE THE EXTENTS OF THE DATA SET,      */ 00703000
*/*  DSSWITCH IS CALLED TO SWITCH RECORDING TO THE OTHER SMF DATA    */ 00704000
*/*  SET. IF SWITCH IS SUCCESSFUL THE RECORD IS WRITTEN TO THE NEW   */ 00705000
*/*  SET. IF THE SWITCH RESULTED IN DATA LOST(DISASTER) CONDITION,   */ 00706000
*/*  THE RECORD LOST COUNT IS UPDATED.                               */ 00707000
*/*                                                                  */ 00708000
*/*  OPERATION=                                                      */ 00709000
*/*    SEE SPACECHK SEGMENT SPECS FOR FUNCTION/OPERATION OF THE TWO  */ 00710000
*/*    RESIDENT CONVERT ROUTINES- IECPRLTV AND IECPCNVT.             */ 00711000
*/*                                                                  */ 00712000
*/*ENTRY POINT= IN-LINE SEGMENT                                      */ 00713000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 00714000
*/*    BLKSILST- BUFFER SIZE + OVERHEAD FOR LAST BLK ON A TRACK      */ 00715000
*/*    RECORDING DATA SET DCB                                        */ 00716000
*/*                                                                  */ 00717000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 00718000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- BUFFER WRITTEN TO SMF DATA SET               */ 00719000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00720000
*/*    SMCABSW- SWITCH SET INDICATING WHICH BUFFER HALF IS CURRENT   */ 00721000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00722000
*/*                                                                  */ 00723000
*/*  CONDITIONS= DATA LOST(DISASTER) CODITION TRYING TO SWITCH       */ 00724000
*/*              RECORDING TO AN EMPTY DATA SET                      */ 00725000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00726000
*/*    SMCADSCT- RECORD LOST COUNT UPDATED                           */ 00727000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00728000
*/*                                                                  */ 00729000
*/********************************************************************/ 00730000
*BUFF='0'B;                                                        0242 00731000

*    GEN(LM    1,14,0(3));             /* RESTORE REGISTERS          */ 00771000

         B     @RC00172                                            0285 00843000

*/********************************************************************/ 00845000
*/*                                                                  */ 00846000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= RECOVERY                                            */ 00847000
*/*                                                                  */ 00848000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= DISASTER RECOVERY ATTEMPT                       */ 00849000
*/*                                                                  */ 00850000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 00851000
*/*  ATTEMPT TO RECOVER THE USE OF AN SMF DATA SET UPON BEING POSTED */ 00852000
*/*  WHILE IN DISASTER MODE, I.E. RECORDING HAS BEEN LOST.           */ 00853000
*/*  CALL DSSWITCH TO TRY TO OPEN AN SMF DATA SET AND IF STILL NOT   */ 00854000
*/*  AVAILABLE INCREMENT THE COUNT OF LOST RECORDS. IF A DATA SET WAS*/ 00855000
*/*  OPENED CALL BWRITER TO WRITE THE NON CURRENT BUFFER IF NOT      */ 00856000
*/*  EMPTY, THEN THE CURRENT BUFFER. IF IN EITHER CASE THE WRITE     */ 00857000
*/*  RESULTS IN A RETURN TO DISASTER MODE THE COUNT OF LOST RECORDS  */ 00858000
*/*  IS INCREMENTED AND NO RECOVERY IS MADE.                         */ 00859000
*/*  IF THE CURRENT BUFFER WAS SUCCESSFULLY WRITTEN RECORD TYPE 7 IS */ 00860000
*/*  BUILT AND PLACED IN THE CURRENT BUFFER. WRITEMSG IS CALLED TO   */ 00861000
*/*  ISSUE THE SMF RECORDING MESSAGE.                                */ 00862000
*/*                                                                  */ 00863000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 00864000
*/*                                                                  */ 00865000
*/*ENTRY POINT= IN-LINE SEGMENT                                      */ 00866000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 00867000
*/*    SMF BUFFERS                                                   */ 00868000
*/*    SMCASID- SYSTEM ID                                            */ 00869000
*/*    SMCADSTM- TIME AND DATE OF DISASTER                           */ 00870000
*/*    SMCADSCT- COUNT OF LOST RECORDS                               */ 00871000
*/*                                                                  */ 00872000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 00873000
*/*  CONDITION= SMF NOW RECORDING                                    */ 00874000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00875000
*/*    SMCADSTR- DISASTER SWITCH SET TO 0                            */ 00876000
*/*    RECORD TYPE 7                                                 */ 00877000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00878000
*/*                                                                  */ 00879000
*/*  CONDITIONS= STILL IN DISASTER MODE-NO DATA SETS AVAILABLE       */ 00880000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 00881000
*/*    SMCADSCT- COUNT OF LOST RECORDS                               */ 00882000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 00883000
*/*                                                                  */ 00884000
*/********************************************************************/ 00885000
*CALL DSSWITCH;                        /* ATTEMPT DATA SET SWITCH    */ 00886000
         BAL   @14,DSSWITCH                                        0286 00887000
*IF SMCAPNAV='0'B THEN                 /* HAS A DATA SET BECOME      */ 00888000
         TM    SMCAPNAV(SMCAPTR),B'10000000'                       0287 00889000
         BNZ   @RF00287                                            0287 00890000
*  DO;                                 /* AVAILABLE?                 */ 00891000
*    RESPECIFY SMFBUFFR BASED(BUFPTR(2));                          0289 00892000
*    IF BUFLEN>4 THEN                  /* YES, WRITE THE NON CURRENT */ 00893000

         LH    @10,BUFLEN(,@10)                                    0290 00895000
         CH    @10,@CH00043                                        0290 00896000
         BNH   @RF00290                                            0290 00897000
*      DO;                             /* BUFFER IF THERE IS ANYTHING*/ 00898000
*        BUFTOWRT=2;                   /* IN IT. SET BUFFER INDEX    */ 00899000
         LA    BUFTOWRT,2                                          0292 00900000
*        CALL BWRITER;                 /* WRITE THE BUFFER           */ 00901000

*      END;                                                        0294 00903000
*    IF SMCAPNAV='0'B THEN             /* DATA SET STILL AVAILABLE   */ 00904000
@RF00290 TM    SMCAPNAV(SMCAPTR),B'10000000'                       0295 00905000
         BNZ   @RF00295                                            0295 00906000
*      DO;                             /* WRITE THE BUFFER THAT WAS  */ 00907000
*        BUFTOWRT=1;                   /* CURRENT WHEN DISASTER      */ 00908000
         LA    BUFTOWRT,1                                          0297 00909000
*        CALL BWRITER;                 /* PROCESSING WAS ENTERED     */ 00910000
         BAL   @14,BWRITER                                         0298 00911000
*        IF SMCAPNAV='0'B THEN                                     0299 00912000
         TM    SMCAPNAV(SMCAPTR),B'10000000'                       0299 00913000
         BNZ   @RF00299                                            0299 00914000
*          DO;                         /* RECOVERY***                */ 00915000
*            SMCADSTR='0'B;            /* TURN OFF DISASTER          */ 00916000
         NI    SMCADSTR(SMCAPTR),B'10111111'                       0301 00917000
*            RESPECIFY SMFBUFFR BASED(BUFPTR(1));                  0302 00918000
*            RESPECIFY SMFRCD07 BASED(ADDR(BUFRDW));               0303 00919000
*            RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1) RESTRICTED;                     0304 00920000
*            GEN(TIME  BIN);           /* OBTAIN RECOVERY TIME       */ 00921000
         TIME  BIN                                                      00922000
*            SMF7TME=REG0;             /* TIME INTO RECORD 7         */ 00923000
         L     @10,BUFPTR                                          0306 00924000
         LA    @04,4                                               0306 00925000
         ALR   @04,@10                                             0306 00926000
         ST    REG0,SMF7TME(,@04)                                  0306 00927000
*            SMF7DTE=REG1;             /* DATE INTO RECORD 7         */ 00928000
         ST    REG1,SMF7DTE(,@04)                                  0307 00929000
*            RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1) UNRESTRICTED;                   0308 00930000

         MVI   SMF7FLG(@04),X'02'                                  0309 00932000

*            SMF7SID=SMCASID;          /* SYSTEM ID                  */ 00935000
         MVC   SMF7SID(4,@04),SMCASID(SMCAPTR)                     0311 00936000
*            SMF7STM=DSTRTIME(2);      /* TIME OF DISASTER           */ 00937000

*            SMF7STD=SMCADSTM;         /* DATE OF DISASTER           */ 00939000

*            SMF7NRO=SMCADSCT;         /* NO. OF RECORDS LOST        */ 00941000

*            SMF7LEN=28;               /* SET RECORD LENGTH          */ 00943000

*            SMF7SEG=0;                                            0316 00945000

*            BUFBDW=0;                 /* SET BLOCK LENGTH IN BDW    */ 00948000

*            CALL WRITEMSG;            /* WRITE 'SMF RECORDING...'   */ 00954000

*          END;                                                    0321 00956000
*      END;                                                        0322 00957000

*  END;                                                            0323 00959000

*            POST='0'B;                /* NO, CLEAR SWITCH           */ 00973000
         NI    POST,B'11101111'                                    0328 00974000
*          ELSE                        /* YES                        */ 00975000
*            CALL POSTBECB;            /* POST IEEMB830              */ 00976000
         B     @RC00327                                            0329 00977000
@RF00327 BAL   @14,POSTBECB                                        0329 00978000
*        END;                                                      0330 00979000
@RC00327 DS    0H                                                  0330 00980000
@DE00157 TM    WRITER,B'10000000'                                  0330 00981000
         BO    @DL00157                                            0330 00982000
*      END;                                                        0331 00983000
*  END;                                                            0332 00984000
*ELSE                                                              0333 00985000
*  DO;                                 /* STAE NOT ESTABLISHED       */ 00986000
         B     @RC00103                                            0333 00987000
@RF00103 DS    0H                                                  0334 00988000
*    SMCAMAN='0'B;                     /* TURN OFF SMF RECORDING     */ 00989000
*    SMCAUSER='0'B;                                                0335 00990000
         NI    SMCAMAN(SMCAPTR),B'00111111'                        0335 00991000
*  END;                                                            0336 00992000
*WRITEMSG:PROC;                                                    0337 00993000
@EL00001 L     @13,4(,@13)                                         0337 00994000
@EF00001 L     @00,@SIZDATD                                        0337 00995000
         LR    @01,@11                                             0337 00996000
         FREEMAIN R,LV=(0),A=(1)                                        00997000
@ER00001 LM    @14,@12,12(@13)                                     0337 00998000
         BR    @14                                                 0337 00999000

*/********************************************************************/ 01001000
*/*                                                                  */ 01002000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= WRITEMSG                                            */ 01003000
*/*                                                                  */ 01004000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= WRITER MESSAGE PROCESSOR                        */ 01005000
*/*                                                                  */ 01006000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 01007000
*/*  CONSTRUCT AND ISSUE A MESSAGE TO THE OPERATOR WHEN REQUESTED    */ 01008000
*/*  BY THE CALLER.                                                  */ 01009000
*/*                                                                  */ 01010000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 01011000
*/*                                                                  */ 01012000
*/*ENTRY POINT= WRITEMSG                                             */ 01013000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 01014000
*/*    MSGSWS- CONTAINS BIT INDICATING WHICH MESSAGE TO ISSUE        */ 01015000

*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 01020000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- MESSAGE WRITTEN TO OPERATOR                  */ 01021000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01022000
*/*    MESSAGE:                                                      */ 01023000
*/*    IEE360I SMF NOW RECORDING ON SYS1.MANX/Y ON XXXXXX TIME=      */ 01024000
*/*    IEE361I SMF DATA LOST - SYS1.MANX/Y NOT AVAILABLE TIME=       */ 01025000
*/*    IEE362A SMF ENTER DUMP FOR SYS1.MANX/Y ON XXXXXX              */ 01026000
*/*    IEE364I SMF I/O ERROR ON XXXXXX                               */ 01027000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01028000
*/*                                                                  */ 01029000
*/********************************************************************/ 01030000
*MSGTIME(3:3)=CONCOLON;                /* INITIALIZE TIME            */ 01031000
         MVC   MSGTIME+2(1),CONCOLON                               0338 01032000

*    GEN(TIME  DEC);                                               0343 01040000
         TIME  DEC                                                      01041000
*    TIMEPK=REG0;                      /* TIME IN PACKED FORMAT      */ 01042000

*           REG1=SMCADOMX;             /* GET WTO ID TO DOM  @ZA07764*/ 01074000

*        GEN (DOM MSG=(1));            /* DOM DUMP WTO       @ZA07764*/ 01080000

*        MSGBUF(58:65)=MSGTIME;        /* TIME TO MSG                */ 01097000

*      END;                                                        0367 01099000

*ELSE                                                              0369 01101000
*  DO;                                 /* MSGS DO NOT NEED TIME      */ 01102000

@RF00340 DS    0H                                                  0370 01104000

         TM    DUMPMSG,B'10000000'                                 0370 01106000
         BNO   @RF00370                                            0370 01107000

         WTO   ,MF=(E,MSGBUF)                                           01137000
*IF DUMPMSG='1'B THEN                  /* IF MSG IEE362A     @ZA07764*/ 01138000
         TM    DUMPMSG,B'10000000'                                 0382 01139000
         BNO   @RF00382                                            0382 01140000

*BLKCALC:PROC;                                                     0392 01163000
BLKCALC  STM   @14,@12,12(@13)                                     0392 01164000
*/********************************************************************/ 01165000
*/*                                                                  */ 01166000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= BLKCALC                                             */ 01167000
*/*                                                                  */ 01168000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= CALCULATE RECORDING DEVICE OVERHEAD             */ 01169000
*/*                                                                  */ 01170000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 01171000
*/*  CALCULATE THE FOLLOWING THREE VALUES FOR EACH OPENED SMF DATA   */ 01172000
*/*  SET FOR USE IN THE SPACE CHECKING SEGMENTS:                     */ 01173000
*/*  1- SIZE OF A BUFFER + THE OVERHEAD IF THE LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK */ 01174000
*/*  2- SIZE OF A BUFFER + THE OVERHEAD IF NOT LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK */ 01175000
*/*  3- NUMBER OF BUFFER SIZE BLOCKS(PLUS OVERHEAD) THAT CAN BE      */ 01176000
*/*     WRITTEN ON ONE TRACK OF THIS DEVICE                          */ 01177000
*/*                                                                  */ 01178000
*/*  OPERATION=                                                      */ 01179000
*/*    THE DEVICE ENTRY FOR THE SMF DATA SET IN THE DEVICE           */ 01180000
*/*    CHARACTERISTICS TABLE PROVIDES INPUT TO CALCULATE THE ABOVE   */ 01181000
*/*    VALUES.                                                       */ 01182000
*/*    FIRST, OVERHEAD VALUES FOR NON-KEYED BLOCKS ARE CALCULATED-   */ 01183000
*/*    ONE FOR THE LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK AND ONE FOR NOT LAST BLOCK  */ 01184000
*/*    ON A TRACK. THE APPROPRIATE VALUE ADDED TO THE SMF BUFFER SIZE*/ 01185000
*/*    GIVES THE BLOCK + OVERHEAD VALUE FOR A BLOCK BEING THE LAST   */ 01186000
*/*    BLOCK ON A TRACK.                                             */ 01187000
*/*    IF THE DEVICE ENTRY INDICATES THAT NO TOLERANCE FACTOR NEED   */ 01188000
*/*    BE APPLIED, THEN THE BLOCK + OVERHEAD SIZE IS OBTAINED BY     */ 01189000
*/*    ADDING THE APPROPRIATE OVERHEAD VALUE TO THE SMF BUFFER SIZE. */ 01190000
*/*    IF A TOLERANCE FACTOR MUST BE APPLIED, THE BLOCK + OVERHEAD   */ 01191000
*/*    VALUE FOR A BLOCK THAT IS NOT THE LAST ON A TRACK IS CALCU-   */ 01192000
*/*    LATED AS FOLLOWS:                                             */ 01193000
*/*    BLOCKSIZE NOT LAST = SMF BUFFER SIZE                          */ 01194000
*/*                         TIMES                                    */ 01195000
*/*                         DEV TOLERANCE FACTOR                     */ 01196000
*/*                         DIVIDED BY 512                           */ 01197000
*/*                         PLUS                                     */ 01198000
*/*                         OVERHEAD VALUE FOR NOT LAST BLOCK        */ 01199000
*/*    THEN THE NUMBER OF BLOCKS THAT FIT ON A TRACK IS COMPUTED FOR */ 01200000
*/*    USE BY THE SPACE CHECK SEGMENTS.                              */ 01201000
*/*                                                                  */ 01202000
*/*ENTRY POINT= BLKCALC                                              */ 01203000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 01204000
*/*    DEVICE CHARACTERISTICS TABLE ENTRY FOR THE SMF RECORDING DEV  */ 01205000
*/*    SMCABSIZ- SMF BUFFER SIZE                                     */ 01206000
*/*                                                                  */ 01207000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 01208000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- SPACE CHECK INPUT CONSTANTS CALCULATED       */ 01209000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01210000
*/*    BLKSIZNL- BUFFER SIZE + OVERHEAD IF NOT LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK */ 01211000
*/*    BLKSILST- BUFFER SIZE + OVERHEAD IF THE LAST BLOCK ON A TRACK */ 01212000
*/*    BLKONTRK- NO. OF BUFFER SIZE BLOCKS(PLUS OVERHEAD) THAT CAN   */ 01213000
*/*              BE WRITTEN ON ONE TRACK OF THIS DEVICE.             */ 01214000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01215000
*/*                                                                  */ 01216000
*/********************************************************************/ 01217000
*RESPECIFY DEVTABLE BASED(DCBDVTBL);                               0393 01218000
*IF DEVADDRH='1'B THEN                 /* THIS DEV ENTRY HAVE HALF   */ 01219000
         L     @10,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0394 01220000
         LA    @10,DCBFDAD(,@10)                                   0394 01221000
         L     @10,DCBDVTBL+7(,@10)                                0394 01222000
         TM    DEVADDRH(@10),B'00001000'                           0394 01223000
         BNO   @RF00394                                            0394 01224000
*  DO;                                 /* WORD OVERHEAD CONSTANT?    */ 01225000
*    BLKOVRHD=OVERHEAD-DEVOVHDK;       /* YES, CALC OVERHEAD FOR BLKS*/ 01226000
         LH    BLKOVRHD,OVERHEAD+6(,@10)                           0396 01227000
         SLR   @04,@04                                             0396 01228000
         IC    @04,DEVOVHDK(,@10)                                  0396 01229000
         SLR   BLKOVRHD,@04                                        0396 01230000
*    BLKOVLST=BLKOVRHD;                /* NOT LAST ON TRK AND FOR    */ 01231000
         LR    BLKOVLST,BLKOVRHD                                   0397 01232000
*  END;                                /* LAST BLK ON A TRK          */ 01233000
*ELSE                                  /* NO, OVERHEAD CONSTANTS     */ 01234000
*  DO;                                 /* ARE BYTE VALUES            */ 01235000
         B     @RC00394                                            0399 01236000
@RF00394 DS    0H                                                  0400 01237000
*    BLKOVRHD=DEVOVHDI-DEVOVHDK;       /* OVERHEAD NOT LAST BLK      */ 01238000
         L     @10,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0400 01239000
         LA    @10,DCBFDAD(,@10)                                   0400 01240000
         L     @10,DCBDVTBL+7(,@10)                                0400 01241000
         SLR   @04,@04                                             0400 01242000
         IC    @04,DEVOVHDK(,@10)                                  0400 01243000
         SLR   BLKOVRHD,BLKOVRHD                                   0400 01244000
         IC    BLKOVRHD,DEVOVHDI(,@10)                             0400 01245000
         SLR   BLKOVRHD,@04                                        0400 01246000
*    BLKOVLST=DEVOVHDL-DEVOVHDK;       /* OVERHEAD LAST BLK ON TRK   */ 01247000
         LCR   @04,@04                                             0401 01248000
         SLR   BLKOVLST,BLKOVLST                                   0401 01249000
         IC    BLKOVLST,DEVOVHDL(,@10)                             0401 01250000
         ALR   @04,BLKOVLST                                        0401 01251000
         LR    BLKOVLST,@04                                        0401 01252000
*  END;                                                            0402 01253000
*BLKSILST=SMCABSIZ+BLKOVLST;           /* BLKSIZE- LAST BLK ON A TRK */ 01254000
@RC00394 L     @10,SMCABSIZ(,SMCAPTR)                              0403 01255000
         LR    @04,BLKOVLST                                        0403 01256000
         ALR   @04,@10                                             0403 01257000
         STH   @04,BLKSILST                                        0403 01258000
*IF DEVTOLFG='1'B THEN                 /* TOLERANCE FACTOR TO APPLY?    01259000
*                                         YES- CALC BLKSIZE NOT LAST */ 01260000
         L     @07,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0404 01261000
         LA    @07,DCBFDAD(,@07)                                   0404 01262000
         L     @07,DCBDVTBL+7(,@07)                                0404 01263000
         TM    DEVTOLFG(@07),B'00000001'                           0404 01264000
         BNO   @RF00404                                            0404 01265000
*  BLKSIZNL=(SMCABSIZ*DEVTOLER/512)+BLKOVRHD;    /* ON A TRACK       */ 01266000
         LR    @01,@10                                             0405 01267000
         LH    @10,DEVTOLER(,@07)                                  0405 01268000
         MR    @00,@10                                             0405 01269000
         D     @00,@CF02213                                        0405 01270000
         ALR   @01,BLKOVRHD                                        0405 01271000
         STH   @01,BLKSIZNL                                        0405 01272000
*ELSE                                  /* NO TOLERANCE FACTOR, CALC  */ 01273000
*  BLKSIZNL=SMCABSIZ+BLKOVRHD;         /* BLKSIZE NOT LAST ON TRK    */ 01274000
         B     @RC00404                                            0406 01275000
@RF00404 LR    @10,BLKOVRHD                                        0406 01276000
         AL    @10,SMCABSIZ(,SMCAPTR)                              0406 01277000
         STH   @10,BLKSIZNL                                        0406 01278000
*SPACELFT=DEVTRKLN-BLKSILST;           /* DECREMENT TRK CAPACITY BY     01279000
*                                         SIZE OF LAST BLK ON A TRK  */ 01280000
@RC00404 L     @10,SMCAPDCB(,SMCAPTR)                              0407 01281000
         LA    @10,DCBFDAD(,@10)                                   0407 01282000
         L     @10,DCBDVTBL+7(,@10)                                0407 01283000
         LH    SPACELFT,DEVTRKLN(,@10)                             0407 01284000
         SH    SPACELFT,BLKSILST                                   0407 01285000
*BLKONTRK=0;                                                       0408 01286000
         SLR   @10,@10                                             0408 01287000
         STH   @10,BLKONTRK                                        0408 01288000
*IF SPACELFT>=BLKSIZNL THEN            /* IF ENUF SPACE FOR MORE BLKS*/ 01289000
         LH    @10,BLKSIZNL                                        0409 01290000
         CR    SPACELFT,@10                                        0409 01291000
         BL    @RF00409                                            0409 01292000
*  BLKONTRK=SPACELFT/BLKSIZNL;         /* CALC NO. OF BLKS THAT FIT  */ 01293000
         LR    @00,SPACELFT                                        0410 01294000
         SRDA  @00,32                                              0410 01295000
         DR    @00,@10                                             0410 01296000
         STH   @01,BLKONTRK                                        0410 01297000
*BLKONTRK=BLKONTRK+1;                  /* NO. OF BUFFER SIZE BLKS  0411 01298000
*                                         THAT FIT ON A TRK          */ 01299000
@RF00409 LH    @10,BLKONTRK                                        0411 01300000
         LA    @10,1(,@10)                                         0411 01301000
         STH   @10,BLKONTRK                                        0411 01302000
*END BLKCALC;                                                      0412 01303000
@EL00003 DS    0H                                                  0412 01304000
@EF00003 DS    0H                                                  0412 01305000
@ER00003 LM    @14,@12,12(@13)                                     0412 01306000
         BR    @14                                                 0412 01307000
*BWRITER:PROC;                                                     0413 01308000
BWRITER  STM   @14,@12,@SA00004                                    0413 01309000
*/********************************************************************/ 01310000
*/*                                                                  */ 01311000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= BWRITER                                             */ 01312000
*/*                                                                  */ 01313000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= SMF RECORD WRITER                               */ 01314000
*/*                                                                  */ 01315000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 01316000
*/*  WRITE THE SMF BUFFER TO THE SMF DATA SET.                       */ 01317000
*/*  INSURE THAT THE BUFFER DESCRIPTOR WORD CONTAINS A LENGTH GREATER*/ 01318000
*/*  THAN FOUR THEN MARK THE DATA SET AS NOT EMPTY IN SMCA. ISSUE    */ 01319000
*/*  A BSAM WRITE/CHECK AND CLOSE-T TRANSFERRING THE BUFFER TO THE   */ 01320000
*/*  DATA SET. SHOULD AN I/O ERROR BE DETECTED ATTEMPT TO SWITCH THE */ 01321000
*/*  DATA SETS AND ISSUE MESSAGE IEE364I SMF I/O ERROR. THEN RE-TRY  */ 01322000
*/*  THE WRITE OPERATION EXCEPT IN CASES WHEN THE I/O ERROR CAUSED A */ 01323000
*/*  DATA SET SWITCH WHILE SEGMENTED RECORDS WERE BEING WRITTEN AS   */ 01324000
*/*  SEGMENTS OF THE SAME RECORD CANNOT SPAN THE TWO DATA SETS.      */ 01325000
*/*                                                                  */ 01326000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 01327000
*/*                                                                  */ 01328000
*/*ENTRY POINT= BWRITER                                              */ 01329000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 01330000
*/*    SMF BUFFER TO BE WRITTEN                                      */ 01331000
*/*                                                                  */ 01332000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 01333000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- SMF BUFFER WRITTEN TO THE DATA SET           */ 01334000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01335000
*/*    SMCAPMTY- SWITCH SET INDICATING DATA SET NOT EMPTY            */ 01336000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01337000
*/*                                                                  */ 01338000
*/*  CONDITION= I/O ERROR WRITING SMF BUFFER                         */ 01339000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01340000
*/*    MESSAGE IEE364I SMF I/O ERROR                                 */ 01341000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01342000
*/*                                                                  */ 01343000
*/********************************************************************/ 01344000

*/*SEGMENT NAME= POSTBECB                                            */ 01439000
*/*                                                                  */ 01440000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME=  XMPOST SMF RECORD MANAGER                      */ 01441000
*/*                                                                  */ 01442000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 01443000
*/*  POST THE SMF RECORD MANAGER (IEEMB830) WHEN THE SERVICE RE-     */ 01444000
*/*  QUESTED HAS BEEN PERFORMED. SET UP THE INTERFACE TO AND ISSUE   */ 01445000

*/*                                                                  */ 01447000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 01448000
*/*                                                                  */ 01449000
*/*ENTRY POINT= POSTBECB                                             */ 01450000

*/*    SMCABECB- IEEMB380 WAIT ECB                                   */ 01452000
*/*    SMCAASCB- ADDR OF ASCB FOR WAITING MEMORY                     */ 01453000

*/*  OUTPUT= NONE                                                    */ 01457000

*/*    POST CODE= 4 IF A DATA SET SWITCH OPERATION TOOK PLACE        */ 01459000
*/*               0 NORMAL                                           */ 01460000
*/*                                                                  */ 01461000
*/********************************************************************/ 01462000
*RESPECIFY (REG0,REG1,REG2,REG3,REG4) RESTRICTED;                  0446 01463000

*/********************************************************************/ 01495000
*/*                                                                  */ 01496000
*/*SEGMENT NAME= SMFOPEN                                             */ 01497000
*/*                                                                  */ 01498000
*/*DESCRIPTIVE NAME= SMF DATA SET OPENER                             */ 01499000
*/*                                                                  */ 01500000
*/*FUNCTION=                                                         */ 01501000
*/*  TO OPEN AN SMF DATA SET FOR RECORDING. IT IS CALLED BY 1)       */ 01502000
*/*  INITOPEN TO INITIALLY OPEN THE SMF DATA SETS AT SMF INITIALIZA- */ 01503000
*/*  TION:                                                           */ 01504000
*/*  THE DATA SET AREAS IN SMCA ARE EXCHANGED SO THAT THE AREA OF    */ 01505000
*/*  THE DATA SET TO BE OPENED APPEARS FIRST. A READ JFCB IS DONE    */ 01506000
*/*  AND THE VOLUME SERIAL NUMBER THAT THE DATA SET RESIDES ON IS    */ 01507000
*/*  PLACED IN THE DATA AREA IN SMCA. AN ENQ IS DONE TO      @YM02763*/ 01508000
*/*  SECURE THE RESOURCE 'SYSSMF01 DATASET' TO PREVENT       @YM02763*/ 01509000
*/*  POSSIBLE CONFLICT SHOULD THE SMF DUMP PROGRAM BE        @YM02763*/ 01510000
*/*  OPERATING ON THE DATASET. AN OBTAIN IS ISSUED TO GET THE@YM02763*/ 01511000
*/*  FORMAT 1 DSCB OF THE SMF DATA SET TO BE OPENED. THE TTR OF THE  */ 01512000
*/*  LAST BLOCK WRITTEN IS EXAMINED AND IF ZERO THE DATA SET IS      */ 01513000
*/*  MARKED AS BEING EMPTY IN SMCA. AN OPEN-J IS PERFORMED FOR THE   */ 01514000
*/*  DATA SET.                                                       */ 01515000
*/*  2) DSSWITCH TO CLOSE THE RECORDING DATA SET AND OPEN THE OTHER: */ 01516000
*/*  THE THE RECORDING DATA SET IS CLOSED AND A MESSAGE IS ISSUED    */ 01517000
*/*  INFORMING THE OPERATOR TO DUMP THIS DATA SET. THE OTHER DATA SET*/ 01518000
*/*  IS THEN OPENED AS DESCRIBED ABOVE.                              */ 01519000
*/*                                                                  */ 01520000
*/*  OPERATION= NO SPECIAL ALGORITHMS ARE USED                       */ 01521000
*/*                                                                  */ 01522000
*/*ENTRY POINT= SMFOPEN                                              */ 01523000
*/*  INPUT=                                                          */ 01524000
*/*    SMF DATA SET AREAS IN SMCA                                    */ 01525000
*/*    SMCAFIRT- ON INDICATES SMF INITIALIZATION                     */ 01526000
*/*    JFCB- JOB STEP CONTROL BLOCK                                  */ 01527000
*/*    DSCB- DATA SET CONTROL BLOCK  FORMAT1                         */ 01528000
*/*                                                                  */ 01529000
*/*EXITS=                                                            */ 01530000
*/*  CONDITION= NORMAL- SMF DATA SET OPENED FOR RECORDING            */ 01531000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01532000
*/*    SMCAPNAV- SET OFF INDICATING SUCCESSFUL OPEN OF DATA SET      */ 01533000
*/*    SMCAPMTY- SET ON IF DATA SET IS EMPTY                         */ 01534000
*/*    MESSAGE IEE362A- SMF ENTER DUMP.....  (IF CALLED FOR DATA     */ 01535000
*/*                                          SET SWITCHING)          */ 01536000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01537000
*/*                                                                  */ 01538000
*/*  CONDITION= SMF DATA SET NOT SUCCESSFULLY OPENED                 */ 01539000
*/*  OUTPUT=                                                         */ 01540000
*/*    SMCAPNAV- SET ON INDICATING DATA SET NOT AVAILABLE            */ 01541000
*/*    SMCADSNF- SET ON FOR DATA SET NOT FOUND (OBTAIN FAILURE)      */ 01542000
*/*    SMCAOPFL- SET ON FOR OPEN FAILURE                             */ 01543000
*/*  RETURN CODES= NONE                                              */ 01544000
*/*                                                                  */ 01545000
*/********************************************************************/ 01546000
*SMCADSNF='0'B;                        /* TURN D.S. NOT FOUND SW OFF */ 01547000
